newsitem.title: UK: Peptide shares jump on SmithKline deal.
newsitem.headline: Peptide shares jump on SmithKline deal.

text.p: Shares in Peptide Therapeutics Plc and BTG Plc jumped on Monday after Peptide formed a strategic alliance with SmithKline Plc Beecham to develop and market Peptide's allergy vaccine portfolio.

BTG, which licensed the allergy vaccine technology to Peptide in 1994, said it had created new contractual arrangements with Peptide following the deal. It said it now holds 4.5 percent of Peptide and will "receive certain other payments based on the success of the company."
By 0815 GMT, Peptide shares were up 36p at 365 in pre-market trade, while BTG shares were 15p firmer at 477-1/2.
Peptide shares have more than doubled in price since mid-October, when they hit a low of 170, while BTG shares have been among the top performing British stocks since September 1996.
SmithKline Beecham shares were two pence firmer at 856-1/2.
